    About this site

    ======= <<<<<<<< HEAD:docs/.ipynb_checkpoints/basics-checkpoint.html

    Interfaces - Code Editor and Canvas

    The danceOn interfaces is devided into two general parts – the code editor (on the left) and the canvas (on the right). All the manipulation of the code in the code editor will be simultaneously reflected on the canvas on the right. See Figure 1, the pink red square circled out the code editor, and the purple square circled out the canvas.

    ========

    Introduction

    DanceOn is a domain specific programming language for building animations that react to movement built by Willie Payne. This book is a creative coding curriculum of DanceOn. It contains a series of references, workshops, flashcards, and related study tools to learn about danceOn and creative coding concepts.

    This book was originally created using Jupyter Book. This site is a port of the original book source to the Quarto publishing system in order to provide an example of it’s use.

    0.1 Getting Started

    The online editor can be found here.
